703315f-a.text:
Surf Ave., north side, between West 12th and West 8th Streets. A viuw
of L. A. Thompson's Scehic Railway, still known as such in (1936).
NE6~355  About 1903.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE PEPRODUCED.

702473f-b.text:
(1)
2939-2957 West 8th Street, aast side, near Surf Ave., showing the
Police Station and Magistrates Court for this area. Beyond is the West 8th

December 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

706947f.title: Brooklyn: Surf Avenue - 8th Street (West)
706947f.text:
Surf Ave., north side, east of West 8th Street, to Ocean Parkway, show-
ing at the left the Prospect house, later known as Doyle's Hotel, which was
erected in 1875 and known then as Cable's Hotel. Next is the station of the
Prospect Park and Coney Island R.R. - the building bears the inscription
''Vienna'' on its side-; and beyond the station is the Vanderveer Hotel erected
in 1875. (building with turret).
April 16, 1898.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

706950f-b.title: Brooklyn: Surf Avenue - 8th Street (West)
706950f-b.text:
(1)
Surf Ave., (general view), north side, east of West 8th Street,
showing a rear view of Surf Ave., (at the right). The motor sgpeed-
way is in the foreground, beyond is the ''Coney Island Stadium', and nett
are the car-barns of the Brooklyn Manhattan Transit Ce.
January 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPODUCED.
(2)
TThe same, a later date. In the background may be seen Seaside Park.
April 2, 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

702475f-a.title: Brooklyn: 8th Street (West) - Surf Avenue
702475f-a.text:
(1)
Vest 8th Street, north from the Coney Island (Reigelmann) Boardwalk,
to Surf Ave., as seen across the Dreamland parking grounds. On the
west side of the street, is the'Modern Atlantio, specializing in hot
salt water baths. Also shown is the ''Cyclone'' a roller coaster.
August 8, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
NO RERiDDUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, showing also the Luna Park ''Towers'' in the background.
August 8, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

702474f-b.text:
(1)
West 8th Street, east side, north of Surf Ave., showing the B.k.7.
1ine overhead. Beyond it is the ee--e-ee- police station for this
are2.
October 1928.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2)

January 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY EE REPRODUCED.
(3)
The same, a view further north showing, partially visible, the fire-
house of Engine Co. No. 245, beyond it is the old engine house, head-
quarters for the exempt firemen. Note the figure in frent of it 1-story
up.
December 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(4)
The same, another view.of no.3 showing only the old engine house.
June 1925.

706948f-b.title: Brooklyn: Surf Avenue - 8th Street (West)
706948f-b.text:
(1)
Surf Ave., at the N.W. corner of West 8th Street, showing the former 1
Vanderveer house; which was erected by Mrs. William Vanderveer (Luoy Devlid]  in 1875. Later it was known as the Sagamore Hotel.
December 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(2)
The same, showing the ''Boardwalk'' in the background.
January 1929.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(3)
The same, a partial view, looking south from the elevated statiou
of the B.M.T. lines, ahowing on the south side of Surf Ave; the entranos 1
to ''Dreamland Circus'',''war Exhibit'', ''Scooter', and etc.
January 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(4)
The same, showing also a more extensive view of Surf Ave.
January 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
